title: overly long shebangs can break perl package builds
body:
There are a few perl packages that are built with Build.PL rather than Makefile.PL and in those cases the configure step will generate a 'Build' script. The first line of that script will be the shebang pointing to the perl installation. The perl build system sets the Build script as the executable for building.
```
    def configure(self, spec, prefix):                                                                                  
        """Runs Makefile.PL or Build.PL with arguments consisting of                                                    
        an appropriate installation base directory followed by the                                                      
        list returned by :py:meth:`~.PerlPackage.configure_args`.                                                       
                                                                                                                        
        :raise RuntimeError: if neither Makefile.PL or Build.PL exist                                                   
        """                                                                                                             
        if os.path.isfile('Makefile.PL'):                                                                               
            self.build_method = 'Makefile.PL'                                                                           
            self.build_executable = inspect.getmodule(self).make                                                        
        elif os.path.isfile('Build.PL'):                                                                                
            self.build_method = 'Build.PL'                                                                              
            self.build_executable = Executable(                                                                         
                os.path.join(self.stage.source_path, 'Build'))
```
The problem is that if the shebang line is too long, the build step will fail with a bad interpreter error.

```console
$ spack install perl-module-build-tiny
...
==> Error: ProcessError: /dev/shm/gpjohnsn/perl-module-build-tiny-0.039-n5cctcc3r55bzjmshv2kx7rw2y5k56o6/spack-src/Build: No such file or directory
    Command: '/dev/shm/gpjohnsn/perl-module-build-tiny-0.039-n5cctcc3r55bzjmshv2kx7rw2y5k56o6/spack-src/Build'
See build log for details:
  /dev/shm/gpjohnsn/perl-module-build-tiny-0.039-n5cctcc3r55bzjmshv2kx7rw2y5k56o6/spack-build-out.txt
```
The log does not show anything but running the command manually does.
```console
$ /dev/shm/gpjohnsn/perl-module-build-tiny-0.039-n5cctcc3r55bzjmshv2kx7rw2y5k56o6/spack-src/Build
-bash: /dev/shm/gpjohnsn/perl-module-build-tiny-0.039-n5cctcc3r55bzjmshv2kx7rw2y5k56o6/spack-src/Build: /opt/packages/gpjohnsn/opt/ssoft/apps_devel/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-9.1.0/per: bad interpreter: No such file or directory
```
